reviewText: This is the fifth Monster High DVD release after:"New Ghoul at School", which was the 1st TV special, only made available in limited editions of the Dawn of the Dance series of dolls:Monster High Dawn Of The Dance Ghoulia Yelps Doll with exclusive DVD,Monster High Dawn Of The Dance Cleo De Nile Doll with exclusive DVD,Monster High Dawn Of The Dance Lagoona Blue Doll with exclusive DVD,Monster High Dawn Of The Dance Deuce Gorgon Doll with exclusive DVD, andMonster High Dawn Of The Dance 3 Pack: Clawdeen Wolf, Draculaura, and Frankie Stein Dolls with exclusive DVD,until recently when it was reissued as a retailer exclusive both separately and as part of a 2-pack with:Monster High: Clawesome Double Feature - Fright On! / Escape from Skull Shores, which contains the 2nd and 4th TV specials respectively.Monster High: Double Feature - Friday Night Frights / Why Do Ghouls Fall in Love?, which contains the 5th and 3rd TV specials respectively.Monster High: Ghouls Rule, which was the 6th TV special.Monster High: 13 Wishes, which was the 9th TV Special.After a clever montage of several of the characters shown in iconic movie posters, the movie begins with Draculaura ruining a showing of Veronica Van Vamp's latest Vampire Majesty boovie for the rest of her classmates by continually erupting over its historical inaccuracies, inaccuracies she is quite certain about because she happened to have lived through the real events.  She also thinks the real events would have made a better movie, and she's got a point about that.  Traditionally vampires chose their leader by use of a magical artifact, the Vampire's Heart, which would glow in the presence of the next rightful queen.  But 400 years ago, amidst a growing schism between those who would maintain vampire rule over all other monsters and those of more democratic leanings, the throne opened up and the Vampire's Heart disappeared, the latter fact covered up by Prime Monister Lord Stoker, who has served as interim ruler ever since, after the democrats for the most part fled to the Boo (New) World, all the while supposedly looking for the rightful ruler.  Trouble is that Lord Stoker LIKES being in charge and has no intention in giving it up, at least until a trio of powerful vampbassadors, suspecting as much give him an ultimatum and one week to find the new vampire queen, "or it's sunlight for you!"  A puppet master desperately in need of a new puppet, Lord Stoker decides to pick Draculaura, remembering her as weak and nave and fake it so she becomes queen.  Draculaura is thrilled at first, until she learns the truth, whereupon she decides that the right thing to do is to find the real Vampire's Heart and use it to find the real vampire queen.  What follows is a search for clues scattered across the Monster World, climaxing in Hauntlywood.  Gently Pushed Moral: Well it certainly isn't respect your scaritage though there's nothing wrong with that; rather it is that you should do the right thing, even if you're scared to.In addition to the main plot there is a hilarious parody of the infamous Twilight Teams that has ghouls almost coming to blows over which of Veronica's two suitors in the boovie is the cuter, which is finally settled at a "Cute Court", presided over by Twyla, daughter of the Boogieman, who continues her role as a quiet voice of reason.  There is also a great parody character in boovie director Scareantino.Note: The DVD also contains three surprisingly lame, exclusive (for now) "webisodes" like those watchable for free on the Monster High web site:Crime Scream InvestigationGames Ghouls PlayMonster-Morphoseasbut surprisingly does NOT contain the "Welcome to Hauntlywood" mini-TV special, the 11th, watchable for free on the Monster High web site, that amounts to an alternate ending.

reviewText: The junior monsters are heading to Hauntlywood is this brand new Monster High adventure. In this DVD Draculaura believes she's destined for fame when a secret jewel leads her to believe she's the queen of the vampires. She and her friends make a trip down to Transylvania for the coronation, but not everything is at it seems. Before long they realize the evil Lord Stocker is out to use Draculaura to his own ends and the kids must find a way to stop his dastardly plan.In order to uncover the true queen they must locate an artifact known as the Vampire's Heart. The gang heads to the Tower of Londoom where you'll get to meet Clawdeen’s older sister Clawdia Wolf.  She joins the search and they travel to New Goreleans and travel the The Bijou on the Bayou in a ghost ship. Finally they land in Hauntlywood and meet the famous actress Veronica Von Vamp who may hold the key to the puzzle. Meanwhile, back at Monster High, there is a huge debate going on about which of the male leads in the Vampire Majesty is cuter.My daughters range in age from four to thirteen but they all enjoyed this new DVD edition of Monster High. We especially loved HooDude, the voodoo doll man who was a new addition to the crew (at least to us). There are lots of adventures and funny one liners, making this the show perfect for family movie night.

reviewText: This movie had some good moments like the vampire who transferred from vampire prep in Fright On  TV Special that always putting Draculura down swallowing her pride when she thinks Draculara is the new queen, Hoodoo Voodoo behavior and when Cleo goes all drama team at the Horrorwood  studio I found myself lacking interest in this film over ones done in the past. The Ghouls spend most of the movie globe trotting for clues to the vampire heart picking up new friend along the way but never staying put in any one location long enough the make that part of monster world of interest to me.  The new characters have interesting personalities and hope to see them again in future works but over all the other Monster High specials were much more interesting and this made me wish Mattel would put Fright On and Escape from Skull Shores out on DVD.
